Functions

void linearRegress (Array2D< double > &cxxMatA, Array2D< double > &cxyMatA, Array< double > &mxVecA, Array< double > &myVecA, Array2D< double > &amatA, Array< double > &bvecA, Array< double > &dvecA)
 Given the correlations of the n-dimensional data vector "x" and the m-dimensional data vector "y" and also given their mean values, this function summarizes the data by finding a linear mapping that will approximate the data.

Detailed Description

Given the correlations of two data vectors "x" and "y" and their mean values, the function in this file summarizes the data by finding a linear mapping that will approximate the data.

The function in this file is used as subroutine for the class LinearRegression, where you can directly work with the data vectors and itself and the correlation and mean values are calculated for you.
Please refer to the reference of this class for more detailed information about linear regression.

Function Documentation

void linearRegress ( Array2D< double > &  cxxMatA,
Array2D< double > &  cxyMatA,
Array< double > &  mxVecA,
Array< double > &  myVecA,
Array2D< double > &  amatA,
Array< double > &  bvecA,
Array< double > &  dvecA 
)

Given the correlations of the n-dimensional data vector "x" and the m-dimensional data vector "y" and also given their mean values, this function summarizes the data by finding a linear mapping that will approximate the data.

This function is used as subroutine for the class LinearRegression, where you can directly work with the data vectors and itself and the correlation and mean values are calculated for you.
Please refer to the reference of this class for more detailed information about linear regression.

Parameters:
cxxMatA  matrix, that contains the covariances between the single dimensions of the vector . Only the lower triangle matrix must contain values.
cxyMatA  matrix, that contains the covariances between the single values of and .
mxVecA -dimensional vector that contains the mean values of vector .
myVecA -dimensional vector that contains the mean values of vector .
amatA  matrix, that will contain the transposed transformation matrix , that is used for the linear mapping of the data.
bvecA The -dimensional vector , that is used for the linear mapping of the data.
dvecA -dimensional temporary vector, that will contain the eigenvalues of matrix cxxMatA in descending order.
Returns:
none
Exceptions:
check_exception the type of the exception will be "size mismatch" and indicates that mxVecA or myVecA are not one-dimensional or that the dimensions of the matrices cxxMatA or cxyMatA don't correspond to the sizes of mxVecA and myVecA (the size of the first dimension of cxxMatA and cxyMatA and the size of the second dimension of cxxMatA must be the same than the size of mxVecA and the size of the second dimension of cxyMatA must be the same than the size of myVecA)
Author:
M. Kreutz
Date:
1998
Changes
none

stable
